questions.question: Which of the following checks to see if the assessable record exists for the demand and creates an assessable record if none exists?
answers: A. Validate Assessment Metrics for Demand
B. Auto Business Rule for Assessments

comments.content:
B. Auto Business Rule for Assessments - Checks if the assessable record exists for the demand and creates an assessable record if none exists.

now learning Project Portfolio Management (PPM) Implementation: Module 3: Idea and Demand Configuration (Washington)

B. Auto Business Rule for Assessments 
You can check these 4 business rule SPM implementation module3 DEMAND > Assessments

replies: Auto Business Rule for Assessments , correct is B.

comments.content:
Answer is D 
Read below for definitions
Create onDemand Assessment
Creates assessments for authorized users after a demand has moved from the submitted state to the screening state.
Update Demand State
Updates the demand state to Qualified after all assessments are completed. For example, Risk must be between 0 and 10 or Strategic Alignment must be between 0 and 10.
Validate Assessment Metrics for Demand
Validates the score values for a demand to be within the maximum and minimum values.
Auto Business Rule for Assessments
 Checks if the assessable record exists for the demand and creates an assessable record if none exists.
Idea and Demand Configuration (Utah) under the business rule
Answer found, now learning Project Portfolio Management (PPM) Implementation 3: Idea and Demand Configuration (Utah) under the business rule heading.

D is correct
-	Assessable Record Check: When a specific event or action occurs, such as the creation of a demand record, ServiceNow checks if an assessable record exists for that demand
-	Assessable Record Creation: If no assessable record is found, the "Assessment Creation on Demand" feature automatically generates a new assessable record associated with the demand
As per the course, Auto Business Rule for Assesments: Checks if the assessable record exists for the demand and creates an assessable record if none exists.

questions.question: Projects and which other artifact can be linked to either a program, a portfolio, both, or neither.
If Scenario Planning for PPM is installed, a portfolio manager can access the Portfolio Planning Workbench by navigating to which of the following? (Choose two.)

comments.content:
If you are using the Portfolio Workbench for portfolio planning and want to switch to a scenario-based planning, note the following points:
After installing Scenario Planning for PPM, remove the Portfolio Workbench module and related link from the Portfolio form. The de-activation of Portfolio Workbench is required to avoid conflicts with two methods of planning and data corruption. 

Source; https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-business-management/page/product/itbm-portfolio-planning/concept/portfolio-planning-overview.html
Use the Portfolio Planning related link or the Portfolio Planning Workbench module to navigate to Portfolio Planning Workbench.

questions.question: When creating a resource plan within a demand, how are the default dates on a resource plan determined?
answers: A. From demand start date and due date
B. Resource plan(s) cannot be created from demand

questions.question: A customer requires five (5) teamspaces to support different departments. What should you do?
answers: B. Contact the Account Representative to activate the teamspaces.
C. Activate via each teamspace plugin.
D. Use UI Policies and Business Rules to enable teamspaces.

comments.content:
Teamspace activation
You must activate a teamspace plugin to use the teamspace feature. Following teamspace plugins are available:

The teamspaces loaded with these plugins contain the same components, but the components have different prefixes. For example, teamspace 1 includes a project table named Teamspace_1 Project [tsp1_project] and teamspace 5 includes a project table named Teamspace_5 Project [tsp5_project].

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-business-management/page

questions.question: In which table can you find cost information for a specific fiscal period?

comments.content:
A cost plan breakdown captures the estimated cost and actual cost for every fiscal period. Cost plan, project, demand, program, and portfolio are the breakdowns types that are available.

https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/xanadu-it-business-management/page/product/project-management/concept/cost-plan-breakdown.html

questions.question: What is the default schedule for a project?
answers: C. 9-hour workday (from 8 to 12 and from 1 to 5).

questions.question: The PPM Standard plugin enables an it_project_manager to perform the following activities: (Choose three.)
answers: A. Determine overall project cost requirements
C. Define target for the portfolio
D. Establish resource requirements and track costs.
E. Track actual amount spent compared to an approved budget.

comments.content:
PPM Standard automatically activates Financial Management if it is not already active.

The integration enables project and portfolio managers to perform the following activities:
Determine overall cost requirements for all demands and projects in portfolios
Establish resource requirements and track costs for demands and projects
Track actual amounts spent compared to an approved budget

Source; https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-business-management/page/product/project-portfolio-suite-with-financials/concept/c_ProjectPortfolioSuiteWithFinancials.html
Is there a description in ServiceNowDocs?

questions.question: When a time card is approved, the actual time is stored in which two tables? (Choose two.)
answers: D. Resource Aggregate tables (Daily, Weekly, and Monthly)

comments.content:
When you approve a time card, the time logged in the time card is saved day-wise in the Time Card Daily [time_card_daily] table. Using daily time logged data, you can generate time card reports by days for any period irrespective of the time sheet period to which the time cards belong. For example, you can create a monthly time card report that includes time cards from the first day to the last day of the month.

Source; https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-platform-administration/page/administer/task-table/concept/c_TimeCards.html

questions.question: Which of the following roles can access the project administration application?

comments.content:
PPS admin
[it_pps_admin]

Can view and modify the preferences, configurations, and settings for projects, demands, programs, portfolios, resources, time cards, agile development, and timeline visualization.

Project manager
[it_project_manager]

Has configuration access right to all Project Management application features and functionality.

Source; https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-business-management/page/product/project-portfolio-suite-with-financials/reference/roles-installed-with-PPS-finance.html    ( B-C )

https://docs.servicenow.com/ja-JP/bundle/utah-it-business-management/page/product/project-portfolio-suite-with-financials/concept/domain-separation-project-portfolio-financials.html

questions.question: The hourly rate is derived from the resource rate on the resource plan, if this option is selected.

comments.content:
It is here :"If a rate model is associated to the project or demand, the hourly rate is derived from the rate model. Whenever the hourly rates in the associated rate model change, you must recalculate the resource costs of the resource plan to reflect the new rates."
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-business-management/page/product/resource-management/concept/c_ResourcePlans.html
If the Rate override option in a resource plan is selected, the hourly rate for calculating the corresponding resource plan cost is derived from the rate specified in the Resource rate field.

replies:
In this link itself, below is listed

"If the Rate override option in a resource plan is selected, the hourly rate for calculating the corresponding resource plan cost is derived from the rate specified in the Resource rate field."

Therefore, answer should be A i.e. Rate Override

Where can a user export project data in either a MPP, XML or CSV format?

comments.content:
Export the project data using the Export module, Project form, or Planning Console. Save the export file to a folder on your system in the Microsoft Project (MPP), XML, or CSV format.

Source; https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-business-management/page/product/project-management/task/t_ExportAProjectWithTheProjectForm.html

questions.question: Which of the following are true regarding how the My Project Space (Project Workspace) handles dynamic content? (Choose two.)
answers: A. If the project state is On Hold, actual start date and actual end date are displayed.
B. If the project state is Pending or Open, planned start date and planned end date are displayed.
C. If the project state is Draft, actual start date and actual end date are displayed.
D. If the project state is Work in Progress, actual start date and planned end date are displayed.

comments.content:
Row 1 displays project name, state, project manager name, and important project dates. The displayed project dates are based on the current state of the project:
If the project state is Pending or Open, planned start date and planned end date are displayed.
If the project state is Work in Progress, actual start date and planned end date are displayed.
If the project state is Closed, actual start date and actual end date are displayed.

questions.question: Which of the following states appear in the process flow indicator at the top of the Demand form by default? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
These states appear in the process flow indicator at the top of the Demand form. The process flow indicator:
Highlights the current state of the demand.
Checks off the states that a demand has passed through.
Leaves blank the states that have been skipped.
In this example, the demand is in the Approved state. It passed through the Draft, Submitted, and Qualified states but skipped the Screening state.

Source; https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-business-management/page/product/planning-and-policy/reference/r_UsingDemandManagement.html

Ideation with PPM
Enables you to manage your demands, resources, portfolios and projects, and gives full visibility from idea to execution. Enables you to manage ideas with full visibility from idea submission to execution.

com.snc.ppm_innovation_management

A is correct
When the "Resource Management" plugin is activated in ServiceNow, it provides additional capabilities for resource planning, allocation, and management. As part of this plugin, the "Ideas" module is available to facilitate the submission, evaluation, and selection of ideas for implementation.
